result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed, as evidenced by receipt by this Court of a Certificate of Discharge from the probationary authority, AND WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  State will not object if the Department of Corrections petitions for early discharge provided all conditions of probation have been satisfied.
------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 08-15-2014 at 8:00 a.m.  Jail time may be served in Sheboygan County.
Defendant shall complete eighty (80) hours of community service work during his three (3) year term of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcus A Jones in court with attorney Lucas Kaster for attorney John S Schiro.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND: 13CT326. SO # 13-5418, 13-5419, 13-5420, 13-5421, and 13-5422. Defendants father Gerald Jones to co-sign.   Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.H. OR K.M. NO CONTACT WITH WITNESS( A.V.) NO CONTACT WITH N.G. OR WITH HIS RESIDENCE (CO-ACTOR)   If defendant and victim(s)/ Co-actor(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant appears in court, in custody, with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi. Diane Donohoo appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
